title: For UK Phone-Hacking Case, An End In Acquittal And Conviction
teaser: Rebekah Brooks, the former head of Rupert Murodoch's newspaper empire in Britain, has been acquitted of phone hacking and other criminal charges. But Andrew Coulson, former editor of a Murdoch-owned tabloid and one-time chief spokesman for Prime Minister David Cameron, was convicted. The verdicts comprise the latest development in a scandal that has touched the heights of British media and politics.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
